description: From Middle English leprosite, from Medieval Latin leprositas (“state of being leprous, leprosy”) either directly or via French leprosite, from leprōsus (“leprous”) + -itas (“-ity”).

entries.meaning: (medicine, now rare) Synonym of leprosy in its various senses.
(alchemy, of metals) The supposed impurity or impurities of various metals, understood as causing their deviation from gold.
examples: The purpose of physical alchemy—as opposed to its various spiritual pursuits—was to treat the leprosity of base metals such as lead, refining and purifying them into gold.

entries.meaning: (biology, of plants, now rare) Synonym of scaliness.
